Participants.evidence: Patients with locally advanced resectable esophageal/GEJ adenocarcinoma

Intervention.evidence: Patients with locally advanced resectable esophageal/GEJ adenocarcinoma received PET directed chemoradiation with durvalumab prior to esophagectomy.

Objective.evidence: To determine the safety and efficacy of adding the anti-PD-1 antibody durvalumab to induction FOLFOX and preoperative chemotherapy in locally advanced esophageal adenocarcinoma.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint of the study was pathologic complete response (pCR).

Number_Analysed.evidence: 33 of whom completed all preoperative treatment and underwent surgery.

Result_Outcome.evidence: pCR was identified in 8 (22% [one-sided 90% lower bound: 13.3%]) patients with mPR in 22 (61% [one sided 90% lower bound: 50%]) patients.

Harms.evidence: Preoperative treatment was well tolerated, with no delays to surgery nor new safety signals.
